page.description: Run a program, returning the hwnd of the program run.

description.p: The program to run as well as any additional arguments for the program. Arguments used by the program are separated by space characters:

argument.name: window_style
argument.description: Optional. Default = 2. Determines the mode of the window in which the application runs. The Window_Mode options are:

return.name: hwnd
return.description: Returns the hwnd of the program that was run.

discussion.p: The SYS_SHELL() function executes the specified Windows program (*[xb:program_name]*). Your Xbasic code continues to run, without waiting for the SYS_SHELL() command to finish. The optional Window_Mode parameter is a number that determines the mode of the window in which the application runs. If you omit this parameter, the window will be minimized by default. Contrast this command with the higher level [SYS_OPEN()] command, which is equivalent to double clicking on a file in the Windows Explorer.
To cause your Xbasic script to wait for the SYS_SHELL() command to finish, use [SYS_SHELL_WAIT()].
